newsitem.title: FINLAND: KCI CEO says no surprises in German buy.
newsitem.headline: KCI CEO says no surprises in German buy.

text.p: Finnish crane maker KCI Konecranes International CEO Stig Gustavsson said on Thursday that a closer look at the German crane operation it is buying from MAN GHH Logistics had revealed no surprises.
"We have not found anything that has come as a surprise," he told a conference call, adding the unit's monthly sales after weak January had been "10 million (markka) plus".
But it was unclear when the unit would be incorporated -- retroactively from the start of the year or later, he said.

KCI said last year the German unit would be transferred to a new company with net sales of about 50 million German marks and a Konecranes official said by telephone that the start of the year indicated annual net sales of 40-50 million German marks.
"The early year indicates an annual level of 40-50 million German marks," said Teuvo Rintamaki, KCI finance and group control director Teuvo Rintamaki said.
Konecranes is examining the German unit particularly closely since the final purchase price will be based on net asset value, and this has delayed accounting, Gustavsson said.
